Posts.Content: Stillshell wrote: Now that we have the full Biopsy and are heading to neoadj chemo for my Mom on Monday.  Can anyone help us understand what this means?? (We had an oncology app but missed due to a blizzard) Invasive Ductal Carcinoma ( 3 tumors ranging from 1.2 to 1.5cm) Dimpled skin, but not orange peel Histologic Grade:  Tublue Formation: Minimal less than 10% (score=3) Mitotic Count: 0 to 5 mitoses per 10 HPF, 40x objective score=1 Total Nottingham Score: Grade II (6-7 points) ER + PR + HER2- Tumor: T1c Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Stillshell wrote: I am adding now the pathology report 3 Specimens: 1- 2.3 cm mass lower outer quadrant (stellate in appearance-no evidence of necrosis) (1 lymph included)  -residual invasive ductal carcinoma with Focal Lobular features 2.3 x 1.9 x 1.8 (yT2) -Focal Ductal Carcinoma in Situ-Solid Type with intermediate to high Nuclear Grade and minimal necrosis -Extensive Stromal Fibrosis and Focal tumor Necrosis Identified, consistent with treatment effect. -One lymph node showing Metastses carcinoma (1/1 metastatic carcinoma) 2. 11 lymph nodes (right axillary contents)  1 out of 14 lymph nodes showing metastases carcinoma 1/14 Metastatic carcinoma focus measures .6 cm -No evidence of extraa nodal extension seen. 3. Right Breast Capsule- Fibrotic tissue consistent w/ capsule no evidence of malignancy. Synoptic Report: Procedure: Total Mastectomy Lymph Node Sampling: Axillary dissection  lymph nodes present within the breast Tumor Focality: Single Focus of Invasive carcinoma No Involvment:  Skin, dermis, epidermis, skeletal or muscle. Histologic Grade: Glandular (acinar)/Tubular Differentiation: Score 2 Nuclear Pleomorphism Score 2 Mitotic Count;  Score 3 Margins: Margins uninvolved by invasive carcinoma Lymph Nodes: Total number examined 15 Number of lymp with Macrometastases 2 Size of largest metastatic deposit: .9cm Primary Tumor (invasive Carcinoma) (Pt) yT2 Regional Lymp Nodes (pN) N1a Er +. PR+ and HER2- My Mom is 55 years old and  has IDC with three small (1.5cm) tumors.  She underwent chemo and didn't do well.  She was bedridden and sick the whole time ending the course of treatment with sepsis and almost dying in the ICU. She had surgery last week.  The removed her breast and underarm tissue.  10 lymph nodes were removed and positive (based on sight).  The doctors also said "we didn't get all of the cancer".  We have not been told a stage for my Moms cancer nor have we been given a prognosis.  She is supposed to go to Radiation next. Questions: -My Mom now requires oxygen all the time 2-4 liters...why? -They stopped taking lymphs at 10, how do they know if there are not more positive ones??  I understand that they will use radiation.  But what if there is a positive one in her collar area?? -Is there any way to figure out what stage she is in?
